comments.raw_text:
A community spotted that anyone can create as many cards as they like from the Join Mozilla thank you page:

http://www-stage.mozilla.org/join/thankyou.en.html

Please can we set a cookie during the payment process or something else in order to prevent direct hit on this page. 
Lots of cards can be created.

comments.raw_text:
A cookie won't prevent an intent user from creating as many as they'd like... at most it would prevent people from accidentally creating multiple cert / cards. 

The only way I can think of to prevent people from creating cards / certs when they haven't paid for a membership is to move this step into a background process that runs periodically, getting a list of new memberships from BSD and making PDF files for each one, then emailing the pdf to the member.

Does it actually matter if they can produce the cards? I'm just wondering if it's an issue worth blocking on or something we save until we have the full BSD/ResponSys integration working?

(In reply to comment #2)
> Does it actually matter if they can produce the cards? I'm just wondering if
> it's an issue worth blocking on or something we save until we have the full
> BSD/ResponSys integration working?

As long as we don't care for now that users can print a card w/o purchasing a membership, it doesn't have to be a blocker at all. Frankly, I don't really know why someone would want a membership card / certificate without paying for it, but who knows :)
